thread.title: Tampa Bay goalie clears waivers, will be assigned to Syracuse Crunch
thread.title_full: Tampa Bay goalie clears waivers, will be assigned to Syracuse Crunch

author: Lindsay Kramer | lkramer@syracuse.com
title: Tampa Bay goalie clears waivers, will be assigned to Syracuse Crunch
text:
Tampa Bay goalie clears waivers, will be assigned to Syracuse Crunch Stars Lightning Hockey Tampa Bay goalie Kevin Poulin was claimed off waivers from the Islanders in the preseason but didn't play in any games for the Lightning this year. (Chris O'Meara | The Associated Press) Comments 
Syracuse, N.Y. — The Syracuse Crunch goalie situation just got a lot more interesting. 
According to reports out of Tampa Bay, veteran NHL goalie Kevin Poulin cleared waivers on Sunday afternoon and will be assigned to the Syracuse Crunch. Tampa Bay originally picked up Poulin off waivers from the New York Islanders in the preseason, but he has yet to play this season. He is earning a base salary of $600,000. 
Kristers Gudlevskis, the Crunch's No. 1 goalie, is currently in Tampa Bay. He turned in an outstanding effort in a 1-0 overtime loss to Chicago on Saturday. 
Gudlevskis is presumably holding down the No. 2 backup spot with the Lightning until Andrei Vasilevskiy is ready to return. Vasilevskiy, recovering from surgery to remove a blood clot, should start practicing with the Lightning this week and will likely join the Crunch for some rehab starts very soon. 
Meanwhile, the Crunch currently has goalies Allen York and Adam Wilcox on its roster. York is an ECHL recall and can be returned to that league. But Wilcox is a rookie that the Lightning wants to get minutes at the AHL level. 
The arrival of Poulin in Syracuse, combined with the eventual return of Gudlevskis, may force Wilcox to the ECHL. That decision may not have to be made for a few days, however, until Vasilevskiy is ready to play in Tampa Bay again and the Lightning has to put Gudlevskis or Vasilevskiy in Syracuse. 
Poulin, 25, played 45 games for the Bridgeport Sound Tigers, compiling a 16-21-7 mark with a 2.87 goals-against and a ,912 save percentage. 
He will not be with the Crunch for its game in Rochester today. Kevin Poulin has cleared waivers and will be reassigned to @SyracuseCrunch #TBLightning — Joe Smith (@TBTimes_JSmith) October 25, 2015
